meanings.definition: The action of containing something within something else.
meanings.sent1: The containments of the box kept the toys safe inside.
meanings.sent2: The containments of the jar held all the candies neatly.
meanings.sent3: The containments of the bag seemed to play hide and seek with the keys.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up, breaking the containments of his serious demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The containments of the dam were tested by the force of the rushing water.

meanings.definition: The state of being contained within something else.
meanings.sent1: The containments of the room made it feel cozy and warm.
meanings.sent2: The containments of the cup overflowed with joy.
meanings.sent3: The containments of the suitcase seemed to protest against the overstuffed clothes.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like it was bursting out of the containments of his chest.
meanings.sent5: The containments of the bubble were fragile, ready to pop at any moment.
